result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM (64-06) Defendant Jacob L Repinski in court.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Jacob L Repinski.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Pruden acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.


Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

2:17 PM Defendant Jacob L Repinski not in court.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Jacob L Repinski.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Samuel Berg in court. 
Attorney Pruden made a record that his client not being in Court today, He misread his court date. Requesting an adjournment for a few days.
No objection by ADA Berg.

Adj. 2:20PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Original Writ of Habeas Corpus filed with court.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:01 PM (64-06) - Defendant Jacob L Repinski not in court.  Attorney Larry R Pruden not in court.  Attorney J.J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Pruden and ADA Herrmann had discussions that the defendant is currently  in custody in Jefferson Co.
Preliminary Hearing will be rescheduled via email.

Court finds good cause to toll time limits

Adj. 3:02PM

2:38 PM (64-06) Defendant Jacob L Repinski appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Jacob L Repinski.
State was under the impression today's hearing would be a Waiver, no officer was requested to appear.
Attorney Pruden did not file a waiver, was ready to have hearing.

Preliminary Hearing will be rescheduled.

Adj. 2:46PM
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

2:25pm Court in session

Atty Larry Pruden present in court. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Record by Atty Pruden that Deft is currently in custody in Rock Co.
Deft will need to be produced via WRIT, Court will set out for State to prepare WRIT. 

2:26pm Court in recess
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob L Repinski in court.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Jacob L Repinski. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and hearing requested. Time period for hearing waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): RACHEL KOPP dob 6/27/1988 ABOUT FACTS OF THIS CASE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob L Repinski in court. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
